text:
hey everyone so this is a footnote for my fruit 
agar jelly cake recipe so if you're watching

this I'm assuming that you are seriously thinking 
of making it so one very very important thing this

is something that I failed at the first time I 
did a lot of research to find out what the heck

happens I didn't understand it so if you are using 
an acidic liquid to make this layer right here the

or the mango juice layer say if you're using 
orange juice which is what I use if you simmer

the orange juice for too long it will actually 
break down the agar agar and it will not set

acid weakens auger auger but it can't do it alone 
it has to do it in combination with a long enough

time on the heat now I don't know where that 
cutoff is I couldn't tell you but I'll just tell

you what happened to me so before I did this I did 
one version where I separated the mango layered

two so I did white yellow white yellow and I use 
orange juice which is more acidic the first layer

sets fine but when I came to do the last orange 
layer I have to reheat the liquid because it had

set while it was waiting so I had to reheat the 
liquid and then that second layer didn't set which

kind of boggles my mind because there - exactly 
the same layers but one set of the other didn't

set so I found out later it's the acid that's also 
why I'm using mango juice which is less acidic so

the second thing I want to talk about is serving 
once the auger our girl leaves the mold like once

you've taken it out as it sits it'll actually 
slowly reach out water okay tofu does the same

thing you buy soft tofu take it out of a packets 
let it sit it'll start leaching water so it's

a gel that's not actually stable all the time so 
that means that unless you're ready to serve don't

take it out of the mold so I'll take it out of the 
mold and then you know let it hang out until time

to serve because you start losing water now in 
this recipe I used a higher ratio of odd router

powder to liquid so it won't do that as much but 
if you use a lower ratio say you wanted something

that's a little softer you definitely don't want 
to let that sit out because of leach water quicker

than this okay finally I said this in the main 
main video but I want to reiterate because I get

a lot of questions about this and that is keeping 
the layers together now the keys are keeping the

layers together so that it doesn't fall apart 
when you eat it is to make sure that the bottom

layer isn't completely cold or completely set 
and the top layer is still piping hot because

what you want them to do is sort of melt into 
each other so they fuse and if you wait too

long and the bottom layer is cold it won't have a 
chance to melt into the top one with these three

different things I think you should definitely be 
successful so when you make it send me a photo I

want to see a picture of this one hope this 
has been helpful and I'll see you next time
